snippet: The program is meant to direct an influx of young immigrants from Central America to available services.
abstract: New York City will begin placing representatives at federal immigration court to help make immigrant children aware of support structures available to them, including those related to educational, health and social services; officials say move is first of its kind in city.
lead_paragraph: The program is meant to direct an influx of young immigrants from Central America to available services.

headline.main: To Help Unaccompanied Minors, New York City Posts Representatives at Immigration Court
headline.print_headline: To Help Unaccompanied Minors, City Posts Representatives at Immigration Court
